fields.description: *Assessment* A non-admin user under a non-eucalyptus account is able to run certain Service API commands with no user/group/account IAM policy applied. All Service API calls should return with a not authorized error, as per AWS behavior. Each Eucalyptus Java component has the --bind-addr option under CLOUD_OPTS in eucalyptus.conf. {code} === admin user of engage15658 account === # euca-describe-availability-zones --region --region engage15658-admin@localhost IsTruncated: false === user01 user of engage15658 account === # euare-userlistpolicies -u user01 --region engage15658-user01@localhost euare-userlistpolicies: error (NotAuthorized): Not authorized to list user policies for user01 by user01 # euca-describe-availability-zones --region engage15658-user01@localhost AVAILABILITYZONE eng-cluster-0 192.168.248.26 comments.body:
[~hspencer], if I read your report correctly, it looks like there are two issues here:
1) a missing IAM check when describing availability zones
2) no proper unauthorized error response in other cases

Is it right? Do you see both problems only when --bind-addr is used? I would guess both issues should exist in any configuration.

Hey [~rusvika],

Yes, you are correct, there are two issues here. 

Both problems occur with/without --bind-addr being used.  Below is the confirmation on a 3.4.1 cloud without the --bind-addr option being used:

{code}
$ euca-version
euca2ools 3.0.2 (Sparta)
eucalyptus 3.4.1
$ euare-accountlistpolicies -a account4 --region admin@
$
$ euare-userlistpolicies --as-account account4 -u user31 --region admin@
IsTruncated: false
$ euca-describe-availability-zones --region account4-user31@ --debug
